data.title: Woodburn, Virginia Affordable Management Degrees
data.meta_description: Are you near Woodburn, Virginia looking for an affordable school to earn a Management  degree? Get help from the Best Adult Colleges & Careers Guide
data.text:
2024 Guide to Affordable Management Degrees & Colleges Near Woodburn, Virginia

Are you near Woodburn, Virginia looking for a school where you can earn an affordable degree in management? Start your search here.

The Best Adult Colleges & Careers Guide makes it easy for you to find out about schools offering affordable management and related degree programs near Woodburn, Virginia. Get detailed information about affordable management programs including the average cost of tuition and fees for four-year public, private, nonprofit and for-profit schools. You'll also get a comparison on how schools within each category rank based on tuition cost. Ultimately, you'll see which schools are the best fit for your budget. Click here to learn more about the guide.

Tuition costs on this page reflect undergraduate rates as self-reported by each institution and may differ based on program of study.

How Much is Tuition at Colleges Near Woodburn, Virginia That Offer Management Degrees?

According to 2022 data from Lightcastâ„¢, the average cost of in-state undergraduate degree tuition and fees at colleges and universities near Woodburn, Virginia has been increasing over the past five years. In 2022, the average annual cost of tuition and fees for the 22 schools near Woodburn was $22,552. That represents a 5% increase since 2018.

Best-Value College for Budget-Conscious Adults

Founded in Columbus, Ohio in 1902, Franklin University has earned a reputation for affordability among busy adults who want a high-quality degree that doesn't break the bank. With competitive per credit hour tuition rates, online degree programs and the University's Tuition Guarantee, Franklin students can get ahead without falling behind in everything else.

Tuition Costs by School Type Near Woodburn, Virginia

There are at least 24 schools serving Woodburn, Virginia. Of those schools, 11 are 4-year private nonprofit schools, 7 are 4-year private for-profit schools, 2 are 4-year public schools, and 0 are 2-year public schools, based on information collected by the U.S. College Scorecard. Browse through the categories below to learn more about the cost of tuition and fees at each type of institution.
